channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17952] Fix license headers to avoid dangling javadoc warnings
item.description: All license headers starts with "/**" which are assumed to be javadocs and IDE warns about dangling javadoc pointing to license headers.
item.summary: Fix license headers to avoid dangling javadoc warnings

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I can do this as the problem irritates me too. But it will be changes to 4000+ files in one commit.

Yeah. This is one small nagging thing. It is easy to script away this change but as you said it will touch so many files. I am fine with doing this, in fact enforcing this via some means in future would be ideal (validation phase).
Now that pvary has done the hard work of ensuring future compliance in HIVE-18356, I will do this big change of existing code.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12904496/HIVE-17952.1.patch

pvary and prasanth_j please review.
prasanth_j any chance you could push this change please?
prasanth_j could you please review and push this change?
lgtm, +1. Will commit it shortly if there are no conflicts.
asherman The patch has some missing files likely because of the standalone metastore move. Can you please rebase the patch? I will get it committed after the rebase.
prasanth_j thanks, will do rebase today or tomorrow

prasanth_j I finally got tests to run. Failures are unconnected with this change. So this change is ready to commit.
Committed to master. Thanks asherman for the contribution!
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
